page.title: 01The Houseby Area
page.content: The land that surrounds Houseby is very fertile. The land next to the sea is mostly cliffs and rocks. Down below is all sea. This is a very popular lobster catching place. There is a loch called Lea Shun. While the cattle are on this part of the land they drink from the lock. This cliffy area s a popular nesting area for many different kinds of birds. The Croak is a very large peice of sand near Houseby. The bell hangs in the barn. The barn used to be a church. When people stopped using this church the bell was kept and used to call people for meals.
